title: tiny-yolo3 with half-precision tensors fails to infer
body:
When I am trying to convert tiny-yolo3 to float16 and infer with next code:

```python
import torch
import torch.onnx
import numpy as np
from models import Darknet


model = Darknet('cfg/yolov3-tiny.cfg', (416, 416))
device = torch.device('cuda:0')
model.load_state_dict(torch.load('weights/yolov3-tiny.pt', map_location=device)['model'])

model.half()
model.to(device).eval()

tmp = (np.random.standard_normal([1, 3, 416, 416]) * 255).astype(np.uint8)
img2 = torch.from_numpy(tmp.astype(np.float16)).to(device)

model(img2)
```
I am getting next error:

```python
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-6-b343449851e5> in <module>
----> 1 model(img2)

~/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py in __call__(self, *input, **kwargs)
    492             result = self._slow_forward(*input, **kwargs)
    493         else:
--> 494             result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
    495         for hook in self._forward_hooks.values():
    496             hook_result = hook(self, input, result)

~/jetson/yolov3/models.py in forward(self, x, var)
    206                 x = layer_outputs[-1] + layer_outputs[layer_i]
    207             elif mtype == 'yolo':
--> 208                 x = module[0](x, img_size)
    209                 output.append(x)
    210             layer_outputs.append(x)

~/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py in __call__(self, *input, **kwargs)
    492             result = self._slow_forward(*input, **kwargs)
    493         else:
--> 494             result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
    495         for hook in self._forward_hooks.values():
    496             hook_result = hook(self, input, result)

~/jetson/yolov3/models.py in forward(self, p, img_size, var)
    145 
    146             p = p.view(1, -1, 5 + self.nc)
--> 147             xy = torch.sigmoid(p[..., 0:2]) + grid_xy  # x, y
    148             wh = torch.exp(p[..., 2:4]) * anchor_wh  # width, height
    149             p_conf = torch.sigmoid(p[..., 4:5])  # Conf

RuntimeError: expected device cuda:0 and dtype Float but got device cuda:0 and dtype Half
```

Is it possible to use your models with fp16?
